alert.note: Alert for Cuyahoga; Portage; Summit (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 3:12PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...An intense lake effect snow band will affect northwestern Portage...Cuyahoga and northern Summit Counties Until 445 PM EST.... At 312 PM EST, radar indicated an intense lake effect snow band along a line extending from 12 miles north of Lakewood to near Westlake to near North Royalton to near Hudson, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARDS INCLUDE... Visibility rapidly dropping to less than a quarter of a mile... Up to 2 inches of quick snow accumulation... Locations impacted include... Cleveland, Parma, Lakewood, Cuyahoga Falls, Euclid, Cleveland Heights, Strongsville, Westlake, North Royalton, Solon, Hudson, Twinsburg, Streetsboro, Warrensville Heights, Macedonia, Highland Hills, Mantua, Stow, North Olmsted and Garfield Heights. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this lake effect snow band. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until this snow band passes your location. && ODOT DMS 302, 303, 304, 306, 307, 308, 309, 310, 311, 312, 313, 317, 318, 319, 321, 322, 323, 324, 325, 327, 328, 329, and 617.
